Articles.Content:
Just a short comedy video in a style inspired by Danny2462, Nexter's Lab and, to some extent, SWDennis.

Version 1.0 allowed us to go into the config files and edit the aerodynamic properties of drag. So I experiment with removing it entirely, creating the illusion of being in space and docking to a space station - on fire - at only a few hundred metres above ground at 2300m/s. I then experiment with increasing the drag value - multiplying it by approximately 1,500,000 and then watching helplessly as the solar system practically tears itself apart!

Enjoy! ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/Nhk1BPQxoHE?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

Haha!

Great video, very funny!

Nice parody as well!
The best KSP madness that I've seen in a long time ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
